header.title: Donald Trump UK visit: Carriage ride with Queen SCRAPPED over protest fears
header.subtitle: DONALD TRUMP will miss the pomp and pageantry of a horse and carriage ride with the Queen due to fears about planned protests against the US president.
header.postText: 'Mr Trump will not ride up The Mall to Buckingham Palace with Her Majesty as security officials have warned it would be a nightmare to police, The Times reported. The US leader will instead be welcomed by the Queen at the palace, avoiding any demonstrations. London’s Metropolitan Police is gearing up for a major operation ahead of the Republican’s arrival tomorrow for his state visit.', 'Widespread protests are expected after Mr Trump’s trip last July prompted thousands to take to the streets.', 'Several groups plan to march through London during the three-day visit.', 'Demonstrators are set to fly a balloon depicting Mr Trump as a baby once again and a 16ft talking robot of Mr Trump sitting on a gold toilet is also expected to make an appearance.', 'Supporters of Human Rights charity Amnesty will unveil five giant banners from Vauxhall Bridge facing the US embassy, saying Resist sexism, Resist racism, Resist hate, Resist cruelty and Resist Trump.', 'A Scotland Yard spokeswoman said: A very experienced command team is preparing the multi-faceted policing and security operation for the president’s visit and whilst the Met has a responsibility to ensure the right to lawful protest this needs to be balanced with the complex requirements of this policing plan.', 'Sarah Elliott, chair of Republicans Overseas UK, criticised the planned protests.', 'Ms Elliot said: The Trump balloon is just a campaign stunt for left-wing progressives to get attention.', 'I think the protesters are forgetting the reason for the occasion, which is to remember and recognise the special relationship that was forged during the D-Day landings and the liberation of Europe 75 years ago.', 'It’s an incredibly important time for the British, as Brexit is being reset, to consider a free trading arrangement with the world’s largest economy and their closest ally.', 'Mr Trump 's busy schedule includes a state banquet, tea with Prince Charles and Camilla at Clarence House, talks with Prime Minister Theresa May and an event in Portsmouth to mark the 75th anniversary of D-Day.'
header.socioLingVar: Physical Identity - Physical Features,Nationality - European or anti-Europeans

commentThread.commentText: Just clear the great unwashed rent a mob off the streets this country has gone soft.

replies.commentText: Someone needs to show the police how to deal with protestors. They should look at how they dealt with the miners in the 80s, look at how they don't deal with protestors now and find some more ground. I agree that people should be able to protest butif they pose a threat to others, they should be removed.The carriage ride was cancelled because of perceived safety concerns,so...

commentThread.commentText: The balloon is a few months out of date, fatso has put on a few more pounds recently, it actually flatters him.
The balloon is a Health and Safety issue if an emergency helicopter is needed. The mayor must know this.

How fragile is this Trump man's ego? Someone at the White House asked the navy to make sure the John McCain wasn't in sight, because Trump didn't like the man.  The ship was named after McCain's grandfather who was an admiral in the US Navy. How ignorant are the people who work for Trump.

replies.commentText: Way less ignorant than remainers, trolls or fascist protestors.

commentThread.commentText: Trump dishonours the post of US President. Why would anyone expect British people to  respect him?

replies.commentText: Protestors dishonour the war dead who died fighting fascism. Something that has reappeared in these protestors.
Many British people respect President Trump, and wish we had a leader with his strength and commitment to his country and people here in Britain.
That doesn't bother America. Why does it bother you?
In which branch of the military did YOU serve? Just wondering!

commentThread.commentText: Could the anti-Trump balloon be downed with the use of a few arrows?

replies.commentText: Oh the balloon, I misread as someone else.

commentThread.commentText: Quite right to cancel a carriage drive with Trump. We don't want the rent-a-mob frightening the horses.

replies.commentText: It is a shame the drive will not go ahead but I agree with you!
I'd bet on the horses against those weenies any day.
